content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Extraction System (Source) at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of:
• Extraction system burner inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position at Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)
  – Serves as the originating point for item extraction and subsequent belt connections.

### Copper Cable Factory Interface at Position(x≈2.5–3.5, y≈17.5)
Consists of:
• Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
  – Acts as the entry point for raw materials into the factory.
• New factory burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) placed with direction RIGHT
  – Neighbour relationships indicate connection with an adjacent burner inserter (at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)) and an assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)
  – Intended to interface the input chest with the production unit for copper cable processing.

### Extraction Belt Depot Structure at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Depot wooden chest (belt depot) successfully placed at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
  – Serves as the isolated target for belt connections.
• Transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) located adjacent to the depot chest
  – Provides a link in the multi‐segment transport line.
• Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP
  – Configured with a pickup position at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop position at Position(x=3.5, y=13.5)
  – Functions to receive items from the belt system and feed them into the subsequent processing step.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Belt Connection Target Errors – Repeated “Transport belts cannot be connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object…” error occurs:
  – Always verify that the target entity is capable of accepting belt input.
  – When a steam engine is detected as the connection target, add an inserter (or similar compatible entity) to serve as the correct interface.

• Placement Distance Issues – “Could not place … at (3.5,15.5): target position is too far away…” error:
  – Ensure that the player’s position is within the permitted maximum distance from the target placement location before attempting to place an entity.

• Inventory Shortage – “No wooden_chest in inventory” error when placing a new wooden chest:
  – Confirm that the necessary item is present in the inventory prior to issuing a placement command.

• Variable Reference Errors – “NameError: name 'target_chest' is not defined”:
  – Double-check that all variable names are properly defined and referenced consistently to avoid runtime naming errors.
